summary: What if Loki does come back, and Thor isn't there to see it. What if Tony dies, thinking everything was his fault and not...
body:
What if Loki does come back, and Thor isn’t there to see it.

What if Tony dies, thinking everything was his fault and not knowing there are people who know he deserves to live.

What if Steve dies without resolving the fight between him and Tony.

What if Bucky comes back to find it was because of the sacrifice of so many, Steve included.

What if those who come back wish they hadn’t.

title: Chapter 4: Little One {Avengers x Fem!Reader}
body:
~Part 7~ The Life of an Avenger: Destiny Arrives

Summary: The reader is captured by Thanos and now must battle her way off of his ship, but the surprises just keep on coming. And this is one surprise that she soon realizes she cannot come back from, as now they are nearing the end game.

Words: 7339

Warnings: INFINITY WAR SPOILERS, death, strong language

A/N: Hey, guys…yeah, I know. Talk about a long-stretched update. I feel it, believe me and I am sorry, but I’m pretty happy at where this story is going and holy shit…it’s going. Just wanted to thank you for your patience and excuse any mistakes I’ve made since it’s currently 2AM and I have class tomorrow *throws ironic confetti*. I wanted to post this for you ASAP, so enjoy…if you dare xx

TONY’S POV

  “(Y/N)! (Y/N)!” Tony called out, his voice straining from the tightness of his throat, blood and tears mixing on his wounded skin, but he needed to find her. It was a gnawing urge that forced his buried panic to resurface like a weight on his chest. Once more, he let his person slip between his fingertips, and once again he realized that no one could hate him as much as he hated himself. 

  “She’s not here,” Strange cut in, but Tony was inconsolable, himself beginning to search further inside Ebony Maw’s ship, the creatures dead body still lying where (Y/N) had stabbed him. “Stark, there’s no use. She’s not-”

  “No, I didn’t lose her! Not again. (Y/N)!” Tony countered, trying to convince himself more than Strange, but he knew at this moment that he had lost it. Tony continued to pace, calling out her name until Peter stepped in front of him.

  “Mr. Stark, we…we haven’t lost her, yet,” Peter coaxed quietly, making Tony lock his jaw. “You know (Y/N). If anything, I’d be nervous for Thanos. I’m not really happy about it, but doing what you’re doing isn’t really helping either…sir.”

  “What? Screaming her name into the void isn’t helping?” Tony joked back, his heart not really in it, but understood Peter’s point as he patted him on the shoulder. “You’re on the right track, kid…she was right about you.”

  “Touching moment, you two,” Strange interjected impatiently, seeing as to how Tony’s panic attack had now passed…mostly. “But finding her isn’t the priority now. If it really is Thanos who has her, then I’m sure wherever he is, she’ll be. Titan is still our best option.”

  “Did you lose your emotions during a wizarding accident, or something?” Tony accused, but Strange ignored his jab, instead watching the oncoming planet that their ship was headed straight towards, the impact imminent.

  Walking by Tony, Peter made one last comment. “(Y/N) has never given up on anything. We shouldn’t either,” Peter proposed as he made his way towards the helm of the ship. Tony, in that moment, had never been more proud of Peter. The kid still had so much potential. So much.

  But reality hit him straight in the face when he witnessed the barren wasteland they were about to crash into. With any luck, wherever (Y/N) was, it was better than dealing with this shit.

READER’S POV

  Maybe, (Y/N) had finally lost her mind. Maybe, today should be the day that she gives in to her psychosis. To be free of reality, and live by the flow that life leads for her to follow, taking it one bare, naked footstep through the flower field at a time. Wouldn’t that be fun? To just let go. Wouldn’t that just be the dream? A lustful, 1970′s Stevie Nicks, acid-tripping, peaceful-protesting, flower-powering fantasy? Fantasy being the key word.

  The colors faded in and out of focus, melding together in powdered smoke that rose deep inside her mind’s eye. The closer she reached to consciousness, the more violent the colors became. The more the dust became the fire shot from a gun, bullets piercing her brain with each flash of hair-raising vibrancy. A shock. A bang. An explosion. A chaotic warfare forcing a battering ram into the doors of her psyche that were locked tight around the barriers of her awareness, but the wood was splintering and the fires were igniting. They were burning red hot into a lick of yellow, transforming into the spindly fingers of a wicked green, contorting into a ball of raging blue that scorched her into consciousness with a sharp yelp that evaporated into the humid air.

  Deep inhales were all her body could manage as a cold sweat trickled down her spine to overcompensate the burning sensation that continued to blister her skin. The abrupt awakening sparked her eyes with a newfound urgency and arrow-point accuracy as they searched the dark, damp cavern that she found herself in, the view beyond the metal beams that trapped her as ancient as time itself. The best way to describe her predicament would be to say that she was a bird trapped in a cage, feeling the weight of herself and the chair she was strapped to not firm on solid ground, but rather levitating by the fiery blue energy that had shocked her from her dream, it’s poisonous tendrils wrapping themselves around her bare toes that prickled with sleep. The faint drips of something liquid and the far-off echoes of bangs of the inner-working of a metallic ship caught her attention as she felt another person’s presence suck the air from her lungs. 

  Not knowing the entity would yet to cease her tounge.

  “I hope you have more than some handcuffs and a few metal bars to intimidate me, becuase if you think this is the first time I’ve been in this situation, then you don’t realize how kinky I can really get,” (Y/N) panted out more confidently than her body could manage, just barely lifting up her head enough to see through the wild hair that mangled her vision, hoping to size up her captor. “Honestly, hit me with your best shot. I’m looking for the full production. Entertainment at it’s fucking finest. Really inspire me here. I’m asking for torture creativity…” she ranted until she finally caught sight of her captor through the shadows, his figure looming ominously just beyond the edge of the water-filled chasm she was perched above, and wow. She was not ready.

  “Your petulance astounds me, child. You’re much more brazen than even I had anticipated through my years of watching you grow,” her captor announced, his massive body somehow more intense than even Hulk to match. But what really caught her attention (besides the thing that was growing on his chin that she soon realized was just his chin) was his voice. The voice from her dream.

  Thanos. And as much as she hated to admit it, the name and recognition of his identity alone dropped her heart into the pit of her stomach with a dull thud. It wasn’t just his size, but the way he stood and commanded the room. There was no trace of doubt. He knew what he wanted and there wasn’t a damn thing he wouldn’t do to get it. Years of patience had brought him this far, and he had finally decided that he had mastered his craft. It was less from his words that she perceived this, but from his eyes that were more than dark, but focused. Focused on one path, and one alone. 

  It was one he shared with her own father.

  But she recovered quickly, dragging her eyes like claws in the dirt to focus on his, despite the guttural instinct inside of her that screamed at her ragdoll limbs to tuck themselves into a ball and hide. But that instinct was buried with the rest of her fear, locked tight inside a box next to the other box that, apparently, held her will to live.

  “And you’re a lot more purple than I thought you would be,” (Y/N) responded apathetically. “Guess, we both got an unwelcomed surprise today.”

  “I disagree,” Thanos countered patiently. “You are enthusiasically welcomed on my ship. More welcome than possibly anyone here, in fact. My hope lies in your willingness to give great thought and action to what I am told the late Ebony has evoked upon you.”

  “How ‘bout, instead, I give you a fresh basket of go fuck yourself, and we both go off on our happy, merry ways. Deal?”

  Suddenly, she was jerked forward, gripping the edges of her chair with her chipped nails as the cage hovered towards Thanos, his fist balled in a golden, Hamburger Helper glove that willed her to him. Regaining her composure, she held Thanos’ glare, matching his intensity as she neared his unusually scarred and cratered face that reminded her of a Grand Canyon on an alien planet that nobody would ever want to visit. 

  “Don’t forget that you’re the one in the cage,” Thanos threatened as the tendrils wrapped around her ankles, but she kicked them off with a scoff.

  “All the more reason to prove that you’re terrified of me,” she purred through a smirk as she watched Thanos’ frown deepen. “What? Don’t think you can control me otherwise? Becuase on this one thing, you’d be right…but just so we’re clear, everything else you’re preaching is a complete bust and, ultimately going to fail. It didn’t work for Hitler, so what makes you so special?”

  “Petty how you only see the Universe through the lens of your own planet and it’s many downfalls when there are so many beings, too many beings, for you to even comprehend.”

  “Well, good morning, Mr. High and Mighty. Maybe, I should introduce you to Humility sometime. Guess since you’re deep-fisting a few Infinity Stones, you now think you have all the answers then, don’t you? This just in, buddy,” (Y/N) dared, the fear creeping into her throat, but she shoved it back down, focusing on her words rather than her emotions as she tugged at the Power Stone that, surprisingly, still hung around her neck. “I’ve got one too. Which begs the question: why? You’ve got me locked in this cage with the stone, instead of dead and without it. You say you’ve got this master plan, but so far, I’m not putting the pieces together here, so maybe…” (Y/N) paused her rant for a moment, closing her eyes to take a breath to calm herself down, a plan of her own hatching in her brain that wasn’t her typical style, but a means to an end… 

  Her eyes flickered up to Thanos’s once more, her head cocked to the side in question which peeked his interest.

  “Go on,” Thanos prodded.

  “But maybe because I haven’t gotten the full story, yet,” she wondered aloud. “All I’ve heard about you sounds straight out of a legend from the mouths of people you’d either just threatened, or hired. Maybe I haven’t heard your side of the story yet and since you’ve so stupidly allowed me to live this long, I take it you probably want to share it with me. Am I wrong?”

  “Very intuitive,” Thanos grinned as he took a seat on his throne, waving the chains away from (Y/N)’s wrists and ankles, allowing her the opportunity to lounge in her own chair that felt like a broken lawn chair in comparison to his, but she never wavered in her confidence. “But I must ask: what changed your mind so quickly?”

  “I’m curious,” she shrugged.

  “So it seems,” Thanos drawled as he began to relax, taking note of his prisoner’s false face that she wore, so familiar to the one his daughter had worn in the years before her betrayal. The one that had led to her being knocked out at the foot of his throne while he took the opportuity to interrogate his new and improved right-hand in peace. 

  “Before we start your therapy session, maybe we talk about the poor soul you have sniffing your toes first?” (Y/N) asked, her empathy well-masked, yet unmistakable to Thanos which made his mouth twitch into a tight-lipped grin.

  “We’ll get to her,” he mused, making (Y/N) lift an eyebrow and hold her hands up defensively, motioning for him to begin. “Growing up, my home planet of Titan was constantly on the brink of collapse from famine, disease, and war. Every day was a struggle. It was in that time watching my people starve that I came up with the idea to balance the population. To kill half of the people in order for my planet to flourish in their wake. Random, of course. The rich, the poor, and whoever in between. Chaos into balance. All for the rest of my planet to become happy and healthy for centuries to come. To finally be able to live.”

  “Well, you know what they say about chaos?” (Y/N) sighed, quoting Heath Ledger’s, the Joker. “It’s fair.”

  “I had a feeling that you were right for the job,” Thanos smiled in approval, making (Y/N) smile to herself.

  “Interesting…” (Y/N) mused, wondering if she should point out Thanos’s connection to, in her opinion, one of the greatest villains of all-time, but thought better of it in order to keep up with her plan to keep the peace.

  Thanos watched her face carefully, but she remained neutral, only nodding after her comment as she waited for him to continue. 

  “So desperately did they crave salvation, a solution to their inevitable demise, yet when I offered them one…” Thanos recalled darkly, shaking his head in disapproval, “they called me a Madman. And once my planet turned to ruins, I knew that I had been right. And now, here we are. So many planets so close to extinction, so many people suffering when the solution is right here with me. I refuse to allow another waste of a civilization.”

  “But if your problem is a starving population, why not use the stones to provide a meal a day to those who need it? Snap, and there’s a Thanksgiving dinner for half the world sitting on their table.”

  “It’s not that simple.”

  “But genocide is?” (Y/N) countered, but quickly realized his mind had been set for decades. His expression was immovable, so (Y/N) changed her tone. “How are you so sure that this would work?” (Y/N) asked calmly. 

  “This isn’t my first time.”

  That shocked (Y/N), and there was no way that she could hide it. She suddenly got a glimpse of the slaughtering of millions, blood, gore, and death. Bodies stacked upon bodies. Something out of Chainsaw Massacre. Something like she had experienced in Hydra. How has he not been stopped, yet? Or, at least, had she never heard of him before? This seems like a major issue that should have been addressed ages ago.

  “Surprised? So was she,” Thanos grinned, gazing down at the woman on the ground beneath him, her jade-hued fingers beginning to twitch. He cocked his head to the side. “Maybe she should be the one to tell you about it.”

  Closing his fist, a flash of blue light erupted from his glove as the woman’s eyes shot open in a panic, herself standing up to address her attacker as she drew her sword. Her hyperventilation filled the room until her eyes landed on Thanos, her hatred pure and unforgiving as she started towards him only to have her weapon dissipate in a flurry of bubbles just as it reached Thanos’s neck. The woman flew backwards to land on the ground in front of (Y/N)’s cage, hitting her head against the bars that had finally landed on the ground. 

  Had to admit, (Y/N) was impressed. 

  “You brought me back here?” She snarled at Thanos as she stood.

  “Where else would I take you, Daughter?”

  “Daughter?” (Y/N) choked out. Both Thanos and his, apparently, daughter turned on her. “Sorry, you just don’t really seem like the, uh…fatherly type.”

  “Hardly. And he’s not my father,” the woman growled back at Thanos. “So, now you have a prisoner?”

  “She’s not a prisoner,” Thanos explained casually.

  “I mean, I kind of feel like a prisoner,” (Y/N) shrugged as she tapped the bars with her fingernails.

  “Only until I have your full cooperation, Little One,” Thanos mused, his lips pulling into a sneer as his daughter tensed. She hung her head low, avoiding his eye contact, but the guilt and self-loathing was clear in her face. (Y/N) wasn’t sure why, but this seemed like a very personal blow from Thanos.

  “So this is why you took her? To replace me?” The woman accused, narrowing her eyes at Thanos who still had his lips curled.

  “Hardly,” he responded coldly, echoing his daughter’s words. “She is much more powerful than even you were, and the only one that will be able to retrieve the Infinity Stone that I need. Something you were unable to do.” 

  This grabbed his daughter’s attention, her eyes finally meeting his as he towered directly over her. “I’m sorry I disappointed you,” she whispered.

  Thanos let out another disapproving sigh as he leaned closer to her. “I am disappointed,” he stated, taking a strand of her wavy red hair. “And not becuase you didn’t find it, but because you did. And you lied.”

  The tension hung in the air as they both sized each other up, Thanos not wanting to hurt his daughter, and her probably wanting to hurt him, but knowing that she couldn’t. (Y/N) finally decided to step in. “Uh, not that I’m not fully entertained by your family drama and wouldn’t invest in a Keeping Up With the Infinity Stones, but…this seems like a very personal matter. Should I…maybe step out, or…? Becuase it seems like you two have some things to work out here-”

  “We don’t,” the woman insisted. “I know exactly where I stand.”

  “Oh, Gamora,” Thanos sighed. “How you continue to disappoint me. But my question is, would you dare to disappoint your sister?”

  “There’s a sister, too?” (Y/N) exclaimed, Thanos and Gamora glared at her again. “Like I said, should I step outside?”

  “No,” Thanos denied, focusing his attention on (Y/N) now which she suddenly regretted as Thanos began to encircle her like a shark sniffing out his next meal. “But what I do want is for you to give me your final thoughts on the plan.”

  (Y/N) let out a laugh, leaning back in her chair again. “Maybe I would if you told me exactly what you wanted me to do in this whole plan of yours.”

  Gamora’s face cringed in disgust at (Y/N)’s words, confused as to why this random girl would even consider his cruelty. Who the hell was she?

  “It would be my pleasure,” Thanos smiled as he turned his back on her to return to his throne, beginning his explanation as he walked. In those seconds, (Y/N) gained Gamora’s attention and mouthed, we have to work together, widening her eyes hoping that Gamora understood. At first, Gamora seemed to distrust (Y/N), but quickly realized that the girl was in a cage, so Thanos obviously didn’t trust her. Which made her the perfect ally. “As I mentioned before, I have watched you grow from afar. Ever since you came in contact with the Orb, my interest in you has grown. You’ve been through so much, child, seen so much. You have witnessed the worst of humanity, the places in which resources are limited and want is plentiful, yes?”

  “Of course,” (Y/N) responded, letting the emotions of what she had experienced during her days on the streets consume her. Look, if she wanted Thanos to trust her, she really had to sell it. 

  “This is one reason why I have chosen you. I think that you, of all people, will understand my vision. The assistance that may be offered to those in need.”

  “And the other reason you chose me?” (Y/N) prodded, ignoring his failed logic.

  “Your connection with the Vision.”

  “Yeah, you already said that,” (Y/N) contended after a moment, making Thanos frown. And that was not a pretty sight. 

  “No, child. The Vision. The keeper of the Mind Stone,” Thanos explained further as (Y/N) did an awkward, ohhhhh, right, taking full responsibility of her own failed logic. “Yes, you know him well.” (Y/N) cocked her head to the side. “Well enough, then,” Thanos corrected. “What I need from you is to take the stone from him.”

  (Y/N) froze. No more jokes. This got much more serious in an instant. Yes, aiding Thanos in any way would be disgusting and wrong, but to actually be the one to, not only take the stone, but to be the one to take Vision’s life? To kill the only person, besides maybe herself, that has come anywhere close to the relationship that Wanda had with her brother? Yeah, no. She had to get the fuck out of there, pronto.

  (Y/N) scoffed, still maintaining her neutrality. “So, you think that becuase I’m friends with Vision, that that would make it easier to assassinate him?” (Y/N) questioned. “Yeah, that makes perfect sense.”

  “A small price to pay,” Thanos proclaimed as (Y/N) made a face. “Your relationship will allow you to get close to him and take the stone before he can defend himself.”

  “So betray his trust?” (Y/N) broke in.

  “Now you understand,” Thanos smiled (didn’t think anything could be worse than the frowing, but she was wrong). (Y/N) shook her head, completely miffed by this dude’s departure from sanity and lack of humanity. She was right. There wasn’t anything that he wouldn’t do, and no biting comment she would make was going to change that. Acceptance, whether it was real or not, would be her only way out. “All you need to do is give me the Mind Stone, then this can all be over as soon as it started. Then, the Universe can truly begin to renew itself.”

  “This has gone by insanely quick,” (Y/N) whispered in awe (that wasn’t entirely disingenuous), thinking that just a few hours ago she was back on Earth watching pigeons cage match over some road-kill hot dog from the window of a wizard’s lair. She looked up to Thanos. “You really do believe in this?”

  “How could you even think of doing this?” Gamora yelled at her, charging her cell. “I know that I don’t know you, but this can’t be something that you want! The pain and suffering that my planet felt after he came and destroyed it remains. Yes, there may be more resources to go around, but we will never forgive what we lost or forget who we lost. Never.” By the end, Gamora had tears streaming down her cheeks, anger boiling over. Her pain was tangible, squeezing (Y/N)’s own stomach at the thought of her own friends and family…

  “But this is just one generation,” (Y/N) argued back, leaving Gamora speechless and bringing Thanos to lean closer in anticipation to her next words, his elbows resting on his knees. “Once this generation has passed, and those who had to deal with the agony have come and gone, all you have left is the good that has come out of your father’s plan. I’m sure, whether you know it or not, some people now have already found gratefulness in what he’s done…and I think that I would be among them,” (Y/N) concluded thoughtfully, throwing a knowing look to Thanos who studied her closely.

  “You don’t know what you’re saying. You can’t know what it’s like to lose everything,” Gamora swore, and that’s where (Y/N) let out a dark laugh.

  “Losing loved ones is old news for me,” (Y/N) dismissed. “Once you get through the hurricane, there’s always a way come back from the destruction. I watched my entire family die right in front of me, and I’m still here. In fact, I’ve made a new one of my own, and I can do it again. If I can make it so others can live a life better than mine, I’m all in.”

  And in that moment, her cage dissolved in an array of shiny bubbles that reflected the shock in both (Y/N)’s and Gamora’s expressions. Thanos barely lifted a finger, his arms still resting on his throne that were carved in what resembled crocodile skin. Fitting.

  “Finally…a worthy ally. Welcome to the Black Order, (Y/N), my newfound pride and glory,” Thanos announced as (Y/N) did an awkward curtsy thing that she didn’t even understand.

  “It’s an honor, really, but uh, I hope I can first ask…” (Y/N) began, putting a slight shake into her voice which seemed to please Thanos greatly as he smiled down to her.

  “Of course you may,” Thanos allowed as (Y/N) nodded with a shy smile.

  “Where exactly are we?” (Y/N) asked, suppressing a laugh when she heard Gamora grumble about her ‘own personal hellscape.’ “Maybe near somewhere that I know like Sakaar, or Xandar, or…?”

  “No, I uh…I’ve just heard stories.”

  “If you had been, I promise that you would have seen it’s uselessness. However, I found fragments of the Orb there,” Thanos explained, revealing one of the sockets on his glove to be halfway filled with a piece of amethyst light, “but once I discovered the rest of the stone’s transfer to Asgard, I knew, not only of Xandar’s time to be decimated, but that Loki would be the perfect option to reunite you with the stone.   “Loki? How did you…?” (Y/N) questioned (ignoring his comment about ‘once’ being the fiercest, since she was still the fiercest, so fuck him) as she slowly put the pieces together. “New York. You were already in his head.”

  “He’s quite persistent when he wants to be,” Thanos complimented. “But his lack of conviction is repulsive. His use had quickly worn thin.”

  “Had?” (Y/N) choked out, her voice so small from the tightness that grew inside her throat.

After his attempt to take control of your planet?” Thanos chided her which just…she had to swallow down, ‘then what the hell are you doing?’ And ‘but you were the one who sent him to Earth,’ to instead take a moment to gather more intel about her surroundings. She found a few ways to escape, but only one really stood out to her. “But returning to your primary question, we are just outside of Knowhere. Pitiful place, alas it is where I found, not only the Reality Stone, but my daughter.”

(Y/N) used her right hand to pull Gamora away from the damage, the woman sliding on the ground towards (Y/N) as she used her left hand to force Thanos to crash into his throne, having used the falling boulder as a distraction crushing his body with many crunches that were hopefully his bones, but she doubted it. (Y/N) reached down for Gamora’s hand to pull her up as they both began to run towards the nearest exit.

  “I was going to wait a bit longer, but he really opened himself up for that one,” (Y/N) laughed, nudging Gamora excitedly, but the woman was clearly in shock with some serious tunnel vision. “You know your way around here right?” (Y/N) called to Gamora who was overcoming her momentary whiplash, but quickly shook herself off, gearing herself into a war mentality.

  “Unfortunately. This way, let’s go!” Gamora yelled back, but they both skidded to a stop when Thanos appeared in front of them just before they reached the exit, his image seeming to be unfolded from reality in a tear of red, himself shaking his head in disappointment.

  “You really believed that would stop me?” Thanos reprimanded as (Y/N) handed Gamora an ice katana.

  “Gotta admit, I kinda hoped so,” (Y/N) taunted back, cracking her neck before she howled into her fight with Thanos, ice katanas wielded as she drove them towards his face, but she was swatted aside just as Gamora reached his calf with the hilt of her own sword. Bouncing off his skin which caused him to become unbalanced, allowing (Y/N) the opportunity to throw another boulder at him where he cascaded into the water with a tsunami of a wave.

  Finding their opening, (Y/N) and Gamora bolted out of the throne room and into a stone-carved hallway, columns rising against the left side of the hallway that opened up to the throne room they had just left, Thanos’s piercing roars echoing off the cavern walls around them like a subway tearing through a tunnel. After each pillar, (Y/N) could see Thanos’s figure rising from the water until he spotted her as well. Thinking quickly, (Y/N) used the pillars to her advantage to hurl at him with her magic as she continued to run, the pillars alight in burning purple magic as they attacked Thanos, knocking him back with each blow until the women veered off to the right and away from the throne room entirely, (Y/N) following Gamora as she knocked aside Black Order members. Protecting each other’s backs and finishing off a guard that the first one had started.   “What?!” (Y/N) whisper-screamed, slamming the curtains shut as she began to pace in front of Gamora. “You’ve gotta be kidding me!”

  “No, about being an idiot!” (Y/N) argued back, then calmed herself down again, running her hands through her hair. “How the hell do you even know he has her? All he said was that you shouldn’t disappoint her, or whatever.”

Unintentionally, (Y/N)’s mind reeled back to her brother clutching at her hand before he was shot in their childhood home, his promises of safety echoing in her mind before she shook herself out of it.

  “You’d be surprised at the things you can do.”

  “…won’t know until I try it. And I’m always up for new opportunities to put on my job resume when this superheroing comes to an end,” (Y/N) responded sarcastically, narrowing her eyes at Gamora who was still watching her intently, crossed arms glued to her chest. “I can’t do this! I have to get home!” (Y/N) exclaimed. “I have people wating for me, people I need to protect. I’m sorry about your sister, if she’s even here, but I have people of my own!   “How the fuck did you convince me to come back here?” (Y/N) whispered, still in shock at the stupid decision she had made as she forced a frozen guard between the wall behind where Nebula was strung up by some kind of gravitational pull. (Y/N) and Gamora had been on their way to a smaller ship dock that Gamora figured would be easier to infiltrate, but as they were getting closer, they had heard the piercing screams of a woman that raked down (Y/N)’s spine like nails.

She thought only one of us should risk capture,” Gamora grumbled bitterly as (Y/N) squeezed her way through the opening in the wall to the tablet that Gamora had been punching in codes, glancing up to see the robot-girl from a closer angle, the view even more ghastly up close. The woman’s eyes were frozen open in a state of shock, unblinking. Hopefully, she couldn’t feel any of the horrible things that were happening to her, but (Y/N) knew better. Even when her attention turned to the control panel, Nebula’s petrified eyes still haunted (Y/N)’s mind.

  “Interesting…is that why she’s stressing over the control system to free your sister?” Thanos accused, turning his head to watch (Y/N)’s head flip up to his, her eyes wide at being caught as she began to furiously bang at the tablet until it hit the ground with the crack of glass and fizzle of a dying car battery, herself blowing the wisps of hair out of her face in frustration.

  “You know what, you should really consider making this thing more user-friendly,” (Y/N) accused back as Gamora rolled her eyes. Even Nebula’s was able to let out an annoyed sigh. “I actually know a great tech guy. Stark Industries. Could get this shit sorted out in minutes,” (Y/N) offered rapidly just as one of the guards fell from her ice prison with a dull smack like a drunken Death Eater on the metal flooring. “He was like that when I got here-” (Y/N) proclaimed, but her voice was choked out of her throat as Thanos wielded his gauntlet, bringing her closer to him in rows of red chains that tightened around her body the more she tried to struggle out of them.

  “Not good enough,” Thanos enunciated darkly, leaving Gamora to lower her head behind him as he approached (Y/N), his tongue ticking at her as he placed a finger under her chin. “I suppose now is the time to enforce some harsher discipline, seeing as you cannot seem to control yourself.” (Y/N) yanked her face away from Thanos, her eyes glowing deathly white, far past her usual silver. She caught sight of Gamora mouthing something to her, but (Y/N) couldn’t make it out as Thanos’s fist opened and closed, his fingertips beginning to burn with blue energy that (Y/N) recognized as the space stone.

  “Mind control,” (Y/N) scoffed. “And I thought I asked for some creativity.”

  “Whatever it takes to get the job done,” Thanos grinned just as he aimed his fist for (Y/N)’s face. “Anything more to add?”

  “…burn in hell,” (Y/N) snarled, making Thanos cock his head, a wicked grin splitting his face as the blue aura became a raging fire, but Gamora grabbed his arm at the last moment to point at her instead.

  “No!” she shouted, distracting him just as (Y/N) broke free from her bondage, charging Thanos, but he rounded on her, the palm of his other hand meeting the center of her forehead that made her eyes roll into the back of her head. All those years in yoga and this was the first time that she actually felt her third eye open up…or maybe that was the splitting of her skull. Either way, a rapid-fire projection show of images from her past surfaced in her mind too quick for her to focus on one embarrassing moment at a time. Outside of her mind, time seemed to be frozen as her limp body floated among the blue magic that forced Gamora to fly and hit her back against a stone wall where she crumpled to the ground. She tried to fight the force, but it was too much. The Infinity Stone would’ve killed her, just like everyone else in the Universe except for one…

  Moments passed under the Space Stone’s spell until (Y/N) hit the ground in a runner’s stance, now shrouded in a black cloak with silver detailing laced around the edges like frost in the night, battle armor adorning her figure as her hair fell like a veil of death over her face. Taking a few breaths, she finally rose, eyes snapping open to meet Thanos’s, but all she could see were shadows in a sea of blue haze. She had no idea what was going on until she felt her own cold, broken lips begin to move, mind not in control of her own actions.

  “Master, I am here to serve, ” her voice hollowly contended as she felt her left knee kiss the cold metal ground, her head lowering in a bow of respect.

  She was trapped inside of her own body.

  Desperately, her mind demanded her limbs to obey her, to fight back, to kill the bastard who was dead set to kill almost everyone she loved and cared for, but she was helpless to the spell. And with the gruesome realization of her unwilling obedience to the Mad Titan himself, the darkness overcame her.

~Part 7~ The Life of an Avenger: Destiny Arrives

Summary: The reader is captured by Thanos and now must battle her way off of his ship, but the surprises just keep on coming. And this is one surprise that she soon realizes she cannot come back from, as now they are nearing the end game.

Words: 7339

Warnings: INFINITY WAR SPOILERS, death, strong language

A/N: Hey, guys…yeah, I know. Talk about a long-stretched update. I feel it, believe me and I am sorry, but I’m pretty happy at where this story is going and holy shit…it’s going. Just wanted to thank you for your patience and excuse any mistakes I’ve made since it’s currently 2AM and I have class tomorrow *throws ironic confetti*. I wanted to post this for you ASAP, so enjoy…if you dare xx

TONY’S POV

  “(Y/N)! (Y/N)!” Tony called out, his voice straining from the tightness of his throat, blood and tears mixing on his wounded skin, but he needed to find her. It was a gnawing urge that forced his buried panic to resurface like a weight on his chest. Once more, he let his person slip between his fingertips, and once again he realized that no one could hate him as much as he hated himself. 

  “She’s not here,” Strange cut in, but Tony was inconsolable, himself beginning to search further inside Ebony Maw’s ship, the creatures dead body still lying where (Y/N) had stabbed him. “Stark, there’s no use. She’s not-”

  “No, I didn’t lose her! Not again. (Y/N)!” Tony countered, trying to convince himself more than Strange, but he knew at this moment that he had lost it. Tony continued to pace, calling out her name until Peter stepped in front of him.

  “Mr. Stark, we…we haven’t lost her, yet,” Peter coaxed quietly, making Tony lock his jaw. “You know (Y/N). If anything, I’d be nervous for Thanos. I’m not really happy about it, but doing what you’re doing isn’t really helping either…sir.”

  “What? Screaming her name into the void isn’t helping?” Tony joked back, his heart not really in it, but understood Peter’s point as he patted him on the shoulder. “You’re on the right track, kid…she was right about you.”

  “Touching moment, you two,” Strange interjected impatiently, seeing as to how Tony’s panic attack had now passed…mostly. “But finding her isn’t the priority now. If it really is Thanos who has her, then I’m sure wherever he is, she’ll be. Titan is still our best option.”

  “Did you lose your emotions during a wizarding accident, or something?” Tony accused, but Strange ignored his jab, instead watching the oncoming planet that their ship was headed straight towards, the impact imminent.

  Walking by Tony, Peter made one last comment. “(Y/N) has never given up on anything. We shouldn’t either,” Peter proposed as he made his way towards the helm of the ship. Tony, in that moment, had never been more proud of Peter. The kid still had so much potential. So much.

  But reality hit him straight in the face when he witnessed the barren wasteland they were about to crash into. With any luck, wherever (Y/N) was, it was better than dealing with this shit.

READER’S POV

  Maybe, (Y/N) had finally lost her mind. Maybe, today should be the day that she gives in to her psychosis. To be free of reality, and live by the flow that life leads for her to follow, taking it one bare, naked footstep through the flower field at a time. Wouldn’t that be fun? To just let go. Wouldn’t that just be the dream? A lustful, 1970′s Stevie Nicks, acid-tripping, peaceful-protesting, flower-powering fantasy? Fantasy being the key word.

  The colors faded in and out of focus, melding together in powdered smoke that rose deep inside her mind’s eye. The closer she reached to consciousness, the more violent the colors became. The more the dust became the fire shot from a gun, bullets piercing her brain with each flash of hair-raising vibrancy. A shock. A bang. An explosion. A chaotic warfare forcing a battering ram into the doors of her psyche that were locked tight around the barriers of her awareness, but the wood was splintering and the fires were igniting. They were burning red hot into a lick of yellow, transforming into the spindly fingers of a wicked green, contorting into a ball of raging blue that scorched her into consciousness with a sharp yelp that evaporated into the humid air.

  Deep inhales were all her body could manage as a cold sweat trickled down her spine to overcompensate the burning sensation that continued to blister her skin. The abrupt awakening sparked her eyes with a newfound urgency and arrow-point accuracy as they searched the dark, damp cavern that she found herself in, the view beyond the metal beams that trapped her as ancient as time itself. The best way to describe her predicament would be to say that she was a bird trapped in a cage, feeling the weight of herself and the chair she was strapped to not firm on solid ground, but rather levitating by the fiery blue energy that had shocked her from her dream, it’s poisonous tendrils wrapping themselves around her bare toes that prickled with sleep. The faint drips of something liquid and the far-off echoes of bangs of the inner-working of a metallic ship caught her attention as she felt another person’s presence suck the air from her lungs. 

  Not knowing the entity would yet to cease her tounge.

  “I hope you have more than some handcuffs and a few metal bars to intimidate me, becuase if you think this is the first time I’ve been in this situation, then you don’t realize how kinky I can really get,” (Y/N) panted out more confidently than her body could manage, just barely lifting up her head enough to see through the wild hair that mangled her vision, hoping to size up her captor. “Honestly, hit me with your best shot. I’m looking for the full production. Entertainment at it’s fucking finest. Really inspire me here. I’m asking for torture creativity…” she ranted until she finally caught sight of her captor through the shadows, his figure looming ominously just beyond the edge of the water-filled chasm she was perched above, and wow. She was not ready.

  “Your petulance astounds me, child. You’re much more brazen than even I had anticipated through my years of watching you grow,” her captor announced, his massive body somehow more intense than even Hulk to match. But what really caught her attention (besides the thing that was growing on his chin that she soon realized was just his chin) was his voice. The voice from her dream.

  Thanos. And as much as she hated to admit it, the name and recognition of his identity alone dropped her heart into the pit of her stomach with a dull thud. It wasn’t just his size, but the way he stood and commanded the room. There was no trace of doubt. He knew what he wanted and there wasn’t a damn thing he wouldn’t do to get it. Years of patience had brought him this far, and he had finally decided that he had mastered his craft. It was less from his words that she perceived this, but from his eyes that were more than dark, but focused. Focused on one path, and one alone. 

  It was one he shared with her own father.

  But she recovered quickly, dragging her eyes like claws in the dirt to focus on his, despite the guttural instinct inside of her that screamed at her ragdoll limbs to tuck themselves into a ball and hide. But that instinct was buried with the rest of her fear, locked tight inside a box next to the other box that, apparently, held her will to live.

  “And you’re a lot more purple than I thought you would be,” (Y/N) responded apathetically. “Guess, we both got an unwelcomed surprise today.”

  “I disagree,” Thanos countered patiently. “You are enthusiasically welcomed on my ship. More welcome than possibly anyone here, in fact. My hope lies in your willingness to give great thought and action to what I am told the late Ebony has evoked upon you.”

  “How ‘bout, instead, I give you a fresh basket of go fuck yourself, and we both go off on our happy, merry ways. Deal?”

  Suddenly, she was jerked forward, gripping the edges of her chair with her chipped nails as the cage hovered towards Thanos, his fist balled in a golden, Hamburger Helper glove that willed her to him. Regaining her composure, she held Thanos’ glare, matching his intensity as she neared his unusually scarred and cratered face that reminded her of a Grand Canyon on an alien planet that nobody would ever want to visit. 

  “Don’t forget that you’re the one in the cage,” Thanos threatened as the tendrils wrapped around her ankles, but she kicked them off with a scoff.

  “All the more reason to prove that you’re terrified of me,” she purred through a smirk as she watched Thanos’ frown deepen. “What? Don’t think you can control me otherwise? Becuase on this one thing, you’d be right…but just so we’re clear, everything else you’re preaching is a complete bust and, ultimately going to fail. It didn’t work for Hitler, so what makes you so special?”

  “Petty how you only see the Universe through the lens of your own planet and it’s many downfalls when there are so many beings, too many beings, for you to even comprehend.”

  “Well, good morning, Mr. High and Mighty. Maybe, I should introduce you to Humility sometime. Guess since you’re deep-fisting a few Infinity Stones, you now think you have all the answers then, don’t you?   “Interesting…is that why she’s stressing over the control system to free your sister?” Thanos accused, turning his head to watch (Y/N)’s head flip up to his, her eyes wide at being caught as she began to furiously bang at the tablet until it hit the ground with the crack of glass and fizzle of a dying car battery, herself blowing the wisps of hair out of her face in frustration.

  “You know what, you should really consider making this thing more user-friendly,” (Y/N) accused back as Gamora rolled her eyes. Even Nebula’s was able to let out an annoyed sigh. “I actually know a great tech guy. Stark Industries. Could get this shit sorted out in minutes,” (Y/N) offered rapidly just as one of the guards fell from her ice prison with a dull smack like a drunken Death Eater on the metal flooring. “He was like that when I got here-” (Y/N) proclaimed, but her voice was choked out of her throat as Thanos wielded his gauntlet, bringing her closer to him in rows of red chains that tightened around her body the more she tried to struggle out of them.

   “Children,” Thanos grumbled lowly as he looked down on Gamora. “I never taught you to lie…that’s why you’re so bad at it,” Thanos hissed at her, then turned his attention to (Y/N). “And I thought better of you. Expected more of you. An open mind and more common sense.”

  “I mean, thought that was a pretty good run…considering,” (Y/N) croaked out, her midsection being strangled by the anaconda-like pressure.

  “Not good enough,” Thanos enunciated darkly, leaving Gamora to lower her head behind him as he approached (Y/N), his tongue ticking at her as he placed a finger under her chin. “I suppose now is the time to enforce some harsher discipline, seeing as you cannot seem to control yourself.” (Y/N) yanked her face away from Thanos, her eyes glowing deathly white, far past her usual silver. She caught sight of Gamora mouthing something to her, but (Y/N) couldn’t make it out as Thanos’s fist opened and closed, his fingertips beginning to burn with blue energy that (Y/N) recognized as the space stone.

  “Mind control,” (Y/N) scoffed. “And I thought I asked for some creativity.”

  “Whatever it takes to get the job done,” Thanos grinned just as he aimed his fist for (Y/N)’s face. “Anything more to add?”

  “…burn in hell,” (Y/N) snarled, making Thanos cock his head, a wicked grin splitting his face as the blue aura became a raging fire, but Gamora grabbed his arm at the last moment to point at her instead.

  “No!” she shouted, distracting him just as (Y/N) broke free from her bondage, charging Thanos, but he rounded on her, the palm of his other hand meeting the center of her forehead that made her eyes roll into the back of her head. All those years in yoga and this was the first time that she actually felt her third eye open up…or maybe that was the splitting of her skull. Either way, a rapid-fire projection show of images from her past surfaced in her mind too quick for her to focus on one embarrassing moment at a time. Outside of her mind, time seemed to be frozen as her limp body floated among the blue magic that forced Gamora to fly and hit her back against a stone wall where she crumpled to the ground. She tried to fight the force, but it was too much. The Infinity Stone would’ve killed her, just like everyone else in the Universe except for one…

  Moments passed under the Space Stone’s spell until (Y/N) hit the ground in a runner’s stance, now shrouded in a black cloak with silver detailing laced around the edges like frost in the night, battle armor adorning her figure as her hair fell like a veil of death over her face. Taking a few breaths, she finally rose, eyes snapping open to meet Thanos’s, but all she could see were shadows in a sea of blue haze. She had no idea what was going on until she felt her own cold, broken lips begin to move, mind not in control of her own actions.

  “Master, I am here to serve, ” her voice hollowly contended as she felt her left knee kiss the cold metal ground, her head lowering in a bow of respect.

  She was trapped inside of her own body.

  Desperately, her mind demanded her limbs to obey her, to fight back, to kill the bastard who was dead set to kill almost everyone she loved and cared for, but she was helpless to the spell. And with the gruesome realization of her unwilling obedience to the Mad Titan himself, the darkness overcame her.
